title: What are the benefits of online learning? - Quora

response.answer_text: Today, people mostly prefer web-based learning over old-school methods. Schools, colleges or other educational institutions, as well as corporate training, have considered e-learning software as the most feasible approach to train people in bulk. So, what is e-learning?  E-learning refers to the system of imparting knowledge via electronic media, typically on the internet. Learning that takes place on the world wide web and outside the traditional classroom is termed as e-learning. There are companies in the market similar to ProProfs who excels in making e-learning or training software. One can develop engaging courses using such software and share the courses easily online. But, why will someone prefer e-learning to teach students or train employees? The answer to it is really simple. The advantages one can enjoy with e-learning or web-based learning compels users to leave behind the traditional methods and adopt e-learning for good. Let’s have an overview of the critical advantages of e-learning: 1. Scalability and Flexibility The content can be made as informative and engaging as possible by incorporating images, videos, ppts, quizzes, and other types of gamification. Also, the best part of web-based learning is that the courses are easily accessible from anywhere and at any point in time. This feature offers the much-needed flexibility in education which is, otherwise, absent in traditional methods. 2. Capacity and Consistency Web-based learning has proved to be the perfect solution for those companies who have global business outreach. They can easily train 1000+ learners at the same time irrespective of where they are situated. The same course is shared between large groups, thereby, ensuring consistency in the message that is communicated between groups. 3. Time and Money Saving Whether you are developing a course on your own or using a training maker software, web-based learning is an ideal way to save time and money. The training software helps you to create courses without any software installation and it proves to be a one-time investment with a promise to get you better results. You can provide budget-friendly training to overseas learners as well without spending money on traveling, lodging and or hiring a separate trainer. 4. Compatibility and Accessibility Since e-learning offers the much-needed flexibility to the learners, compatibility, and accessibility has to be two of the most important advantages. Web-based courses are compatible with all screen sizes including a laptop, desktop or even a smartphone. So, users can access the training courses easily even when they are traveling. 5.Tracking and Monitoring Without a proper tracking and monitoring system, it is not possible to assess the progress made by the trainees as well as understand the overall success of the course. Training Maker, especially come with such a feature that enables the owner or the administrator to track the progress made by the trainees closely. Also, assessing the retention power of each trainee and identifying course areas for improvement are few other advantages taken care of by this feature.  Therefore, E-learning has proved to be better than traditional methods of imparting knowledge in more ways than one. However, we are not discarding the old-school norms completely. But, we can always opt for a method that allows us to enjoy the fruits of both the system instead of just one.

What are the Advantages of Online Training/E-Learning? Online training or e-learning has several advantages over other types of training that could be implemented, for example: Availability – Always AvailableAbility to Refer to the ContentNo Physical Classroom Space NeededAbility to Reach Endless StudentsAvailability – Always Available •	No need to set hours Online training is typically administered via the internet. It can be taken or completed based on the users’ schedule. You are not dependent upon set hours of availability. •	Great for remote users This could also be the case if the training is delivered across a company intranet, depending on the setup of the firewall and accessibility for remote users. Ability to Refer to the Content •	Ability to retake and refer When training is web-based, unless student access is limited to a specific amount of time, students can typically refer to the content repeatedly. This means they can oftentimes retake the material, refer to their notes and read through as a refresher, if needed. No Physical Classroom Space Needed •	Cost-Savings Sometimes classroom space comes with a rental cost to the trainer, team, organization or company. If you are training 100% online, then the student can train using their current location. This results in a cost-savings in terms of rent, supplies, printouts and food. This also results in a time-savings in terms of paperwork and organizing the rental agreement with an additional 3rd party. •	Comforts of home This could also mean that a parent taking the training could train at a home office after the kids are in bed or in an external space, such as the local coffee shop or restaurant. Ability to Reach Endless Students •	Unlimited headcount If you have a classroom of students, you are limited based on the capacity of the room or conference center. However, if you have an online training course, the headcount that can be trained of your course content is limitless. Said differently, if the training was written in the language of a user, they can complete your training. •	Any device Users can take the course from their smartphone, iPad, laptop, desktop or any other device that can reach the internet. Nearly any and every device can reach the internet these days, even certain cameras. •	Time- savings Imagine for a moment that you have 10 classes to offer a world-wide population. I each of these 10 classes has a total student enrollment of 5,000 unique students, that you have 50,000 total students that your materials have taught within a short amount of time. Now think about this, if you took 50,000 students and divided them into classroom trainings in a room that held 40 students at a time, then you would have to comparatively teach each 125 times. At the rate of 10 classes multiplied by 125, you would have to teach 1,250 total classroom trainings. That is a very dramatic comparison at a huge time savings.
